intro: Lamourouxia andicola, commonly known as the Andean orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils. The plant features a sympodial growth habit, with a short rhizome and a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive coloration that ranges from white to pink. Lamourouxia andicola is adapted to cold, dry environments and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
